title: RK Suresh is Vikram's villain in Vijay Chander's next : Celebrities, News - India Today
text:
Celebrities RK Suresh is Vikram's villain in Vijay Chander's next Actor-producer RK Suresh will be playing the prime antagonist in director Vikram Chander's upcoming film with Chiyaan Vikram. IndiaToday.in | Written by Srivatsan A + A - Vikram and RK Suresh 
Chiyaan Vikram is joining hands with director Vijay Chander of Vaalu. The shooting of the film went on the floors recently. While there aren't any confirmation regarding the cast, an interesting news about the film has surfaced online. 
According to reports, actor-producer RK Suresh, whose menacing performance in filmmaker Bala's Thaarai Thappattai earned hit a lot of laurels, will be playing the main antagonist in the Vikram-starrer. 
ALSO READ: Singam 3 Box-Office Collection 
Touted to be set in the backdrop of north Chennai, Vikram is rumoured to play a gangster in the film. 
To be produced by Silverline Film Factory, the film also stars Radha Ravi and Soori in pivotal roles. Earlier, Malayalam beauty Sai Pallavi was roped in to play the heroine in the film. 
However, Tamanaha has now replaced the Premam star. With SS Thaman's music, the film will release later this year. 
Meanwhile, the teaser of Vikram's Dhruva Natchathiram with Gautham Menon has clocked more than 6 million views on YouTube. 
Post Dhruva Natchathiram, Vikram is teaming up with director Hari for Saamy 2, a sequel to the blockbuster Tamil film of the same. He will also star in the Tamil remake of the Hollywood film Don't Breathe.
